description: Use the Figma MCP server to fetch design context, screenshots, variables, and assets from Figma, and to translate Figma nodes into production code. Trigger when a task involves Figma URLs, node IDs, design-to-code implementation, or Figma MCP setup and troubleshooting.
key_workflows: Run get_design_context first to fetch the structured representation for the exact node(s)
If the response is too large or truncated, run get_metadata to get the high-level node map and then re-fetch only the required node(s) with get_design_context
Run get_screenshot for a visual reference of the node variant being implemented
Only after you have both get_design_context and get_screenshot, download any assets needed and start implementation
Translate the output (usually React + Tailwind) into this project's conventions, styles and framework. Reuse the project's color tokens, components, and typography wherever possible
Validate against Figma for 1:1 look and behavior before marking complete

reference_topics.topic: Figma MCP tools and prompt patterns
reference_topics.summary: Quick reference for the Figma MCP toolset, when to use each tool, and prompt examples to steer output toward your stack. - `get_design_context` (Figma Design, Figma Make): Primary tool. Returns structured design data and default React + Tailwind code. Selection-based prompting works on desktop; the remote server uses a frame/layer link to extract the node ID. - `get_variable_defs` (Figma Design): Lists variables/styles (colors, spacing, typography) used in the selection. Useful to align with tokens.
